TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SPNavigationSiteMapNode extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.PortalSiteMapNode

Docs.summary: Represents nodes that are backed by an SPNavigationNode class.

remarks.para: Headings and links are represented by this type. This type can be extended to represent custom node types that are based on SPNavigationNode.

Docs.param: Name or title of the .
URL of the .
Type of .
SPNavigationNodeCollection to add the new node to.
Docs.summary: Creates an of the specified name or title, URL, type, and collection to add to.

remarks.para: This method creates the node as an internally linked node, if possible (internal links to both published and draft items are supported).The type specified can have an important effect on how this node behaves. Heading and Link types are straightforward but an can also have an Area type or a Page type. In these cases, the becomes a placeholder for the Web site or Web page to which the URL points. Only one Area or Page placeholder is allowed per unique Area or Page; additional placeholder nodes are automatically deleted.

Docs.param: An SPWeb object that represents the current context.
Docs.summary: Gets whether the user specified by the context has permission to access this node (or the object represented by this node).

remarks.para: The node will not be returned in child collections if this method returns false. This method emulates the security trimming performed on Microsoft SharePoint FoundationSPNavigationNode objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsExternal { get; }
.property instance bool IsExternal
Public ReadOnly Property IsExternal As Boolean
public: property bool IsExternal { bool get(); };
member this.IsExternal : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value the indicates whether or not this node represents an "external" SPNavigationNode.
Docs.value: true if this node is external; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Corresponds to the property, with one difference. By default, internal SPNavigationNode links cannot point to draft SPListItem objects, but this navigation system performs a special link "fix" on links of this type so that they behave in the same way as internal links. As a result, this property will return false for nodes of this type, even though the actual SPNavigationNode would have returned true for this property. class returns the same value as the value that is stored by this property.

Docs.param: The SPNavigationNode in question.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value that represents whether the SPNavigationNode is external.

remarks.para: This method behaves slightly differently from Microsoft.SharePoint.Navigation.SPNavigationNode.IsExternal. See Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.SPNavigationSiteMapNode.IsExternal for more information.

public: static Microsoft::SharePoint::Navigation::SPNavigationNode ^ UpdateSPNavigationNode(Microsoft::SharePoint::Navigation::SPNavigationNode ^ node, Microsoft::SharePoint::Navigation::SPNavigationNode ^ previous, System::String ^ name, System::String ^ url, System::String ^ description, System::String ^ target, System::String ^ audience, bool forceCreate);

static member UpdateSPNavigationNode : Microsoft.SharePoint.Navigation.SPNavigationNode * Microsoft.SharePoint.Navigation.SPNavigationNode * string * string * string * string * string * bool -> Microsoft.SharePoint.Navigation.SPNavigationNode
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.SPNavigationSiteMapNode.UpdateSPNavigationNode (node, previous, name, url, description, target, audience, forceCreate)

Docs.param: The SPNavigationNode to update.
The SPNavigationNode after which to move the "node" SPNavigationNode.
The new name or title of the SPNavigationNode.
The new URL of the SPNavigationNode.
The new description of the SPNavigationNode.
The new value of the target property. This is used as the value for the _target property on the link rendered to represent this SPNavigationNode.
The new audience to display this SPNavigationNode to.
Whether to force the node to be re-created rather than just updated.
Docs.summary: Updates an given SPNavigationNode with the specified name or title, URL, description, target, and audience,] and moves the node after the given previous SPNavigationNode.
Docs.returns: The updated, or potentially new, SPNavigationNode.

remarks.para: If the URL of the node is being changed the node will always be re-created.
